intro: Poikilacanthus glandulosus, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitats.
